title: Do you need pressure to accomplish your goals?
content:
Do you need pressure to accomplish your goals? In my case, I can't stand working under pressure, but if I don't receive enough pressure, I just can't accomplish any task (I'm sure some of you might have already noticed that).

Do you?------------------------------

title: Re: Do you need pressure to accomplish your goals?
content:
Oooh heck yes, I can't get anything done unless I'm pushed; I'm like carbon, only a diamond under pressure and heat.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: Do you need pressure to accomplish your goals?
content:
Almost always yes. Otherwise, I get bored with what I'm doing and move on to something else.
For instance, I had to make an animation 2 years ago for school. (Don't ask... it was a stupid 5-minute GIF full of inside jokes.) It was one of the only animations that I've ever fully completed.

But it has to be pressure such as grades or something like that. If someone is just pressuring me to do something, I usually don't want to do it. If its for school, I will.-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Take the pressure down.
content:
I just need to have a clear end result in mind, and a compelling reason to make it happen. Pressure can sometimes serve this purpose, forcing me to set boundaries in order to get it done on time. However, for the most part it just stresses me out and I either do a poor job or put up some sort of rebellion.

I've more recently started working at complicated projects little bits at a time, instead of pushing full steam ahead on the same project ten times a year with a short (and inevitably unmet) deadline.

Also, I spend a lot more time planning things before doing the work. otherwise I end up with things that almost meet the basic requirements but cannot be completed or expanded upon without a complete overhaul due to lots of little things I've overlooked along the way.

title: Re: Take the pressure down.
content:
Not really pressure so much as I just need a reminder and a push every so often. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] -----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Pressure!!
content:
Definitely some pressure, I quickly forget old projects if I'm not reminded enough.

On the other hand, if the pressure gets too great, I end up not doing anything again. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img]

---Freeyorp

I can't accomplish them with or without. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img] I don't think pressure has much to do with it in my case.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"

title: Re: Do you need pressure to accomplish your goals?
content:
I really wish I didn't need pressure to get things done, because then I could actually get ahead of schedule every once in a while. But the truth is if I don't have deadlines or someone breathing down my neck I'd never accomplish complete anything.

*sigh*

title: Re: Do you need pressure to accomplish your goals?
content:
I have the same problem. I don't have the kind of work ethic that allows me to work long and hard at something unless I'm consistently and heavily motivated to. With many of my past games and such, I'll do a lot in a few months, and then get tired of it as my mind trails. I don't ever abandon things, though; rather, I go back to them again when I'm no longer bored of it.

It really sucks because I don't like pressure. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img] [img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: Do you need pressure to accomplish your goals?
content:
I don't like pressure, neither. Although, as Mort01, having someone watching my progress is the only way for me to get something done. Deadlines alone, however, don't help me. Again, I need a real person kicking my ass whenever I feel like delaying progress.------------------------------
